item.title: Report E-2023110189
item.description:
Report E-2023110189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XJP experienced a UN2810 SLIP-AYD SL 18 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged drum and all impacted rags used to clean the release were containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110514
item.description:
Report X-2023110514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged in non compatible area.outer container was wet.upon inspection no internal partition.1 bottle had a broken cap leaking out approx 1 gal of content. DescribePack: failure was due to lack of a internal partition causing one bottle to have a broken cap resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: loose absorb and chemical neutralizer were used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report X-2023110505
item.description:
Report X-2023110505

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking during sortation. DescribePack: All 4 gallon containers have defective vented caps. The vented caps failed to operate, causing the containers to leak their contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a lined red tote for processing.
